<script async src="https://www.googletagmanager.com/gtag/js?id=G-HSGPRNE58X"></script>
<script>
  window.dataLayer = window.dataLayer || [];
  function gtag(){dataLayer.push(arguments);}
  gtag('js', new Date());

  gtag('config', 'G-HSGPRNE58X');
</script>

<script>
document.addEventListener('scroll', function() {

    const elements = document.querySelectorAll('.iframe-lezy');
    const viewportHeight = window.innerHeight;

    elements.forEach(function(element) {
        const rect = element.getBoundingClientRect();
        
        if (rect.top <= viewportHeight && rect.bottom >= 0) {

            const eframe = element.querySelector('eframe');
            if (eframe) {
                
                const iframe = document.createElement('iframe');
                
                Array.from(eframe.attributes).forEach(attr => {
                    iframe.setAttribute(attr.name, attr.value);
                });
                
                eframe.parentNode.replaceChild(iframe, eframe);
            }
        }
    });
});
</script>

name.EN: From Goals to Results: Structuring Learning Objectives

data.text: Step 1: Choose How to Create Learning Objectives
When you open the Goals page, you’ll find two main options for defining learning objectives:

items.content: Compose button: Generate content for all three sections — Goals, Objectives, and Outcomes — in one step using AI.
Add Manually button: Enter content for each section yourself, giving you full control over every detail.

data.caption: Choose How to Create Learning Objectives

data.text: AI Generation

items.content: Click the "Compose" button to generate Course Goals, Course Objectives, and Course Outcomes blocks.
A settings window will appear, allowing you to provide details or context for AI. This helps create more accurate objectives.
After filling in the settings, AI will generate content for all three blocks at the same time.

data.text: Manual Creation
If you prefer full customization:

items.content: Click on the relevant block (Goals, Objectives, or Outcomes).
Manually type the desired content in the provided text field.

data.text:
🔎 Note
Even if you choose to create manually, you can use AI at any time
Step 2: Creating Course Goals
The Goals block is where you define the overarching purpose of your course.
AI Assistance

items.content: Click "Compose" to generate objectives using AI.

data.caption: Creating Course Goals With AI Assistance

data.text:
💡 Tip
Start with AI-generated content for a draft outline, then adjust to fit your course.
Step 3: Defining Course Objectives
Course Objectives are specific actions learners should achieve to meet the course goals.
AI Assistance

items.content: Click "Compose" to generate objectives using AI.

data.caption: Creating Course Objectives With AI Assistance

data.text: If the Goals block is empty, you’ll be prompted to fill it first:

items.content: Fill Course Goals: Fill in goals and return to generating objectives.
Rewrite: Continue without goals (though this may affect accuracy).

data.text: Create Manually

items.content: Add objectives by typing them into the input fields.
To add more objectives, click "Add Objective", which creates a new blank field.

data.text: Step 4: Using Bloom’s Taxonomy for Objectives

Bloom’s Taxonomy is a framework that helps define and classify learning objectives based on their complexity and cognitive level, from basic knowledge recall to higher-order skills like analysis and creation.

items.content: Default State: The button is unselected (not highlighted). This means that objectives will not use the taxonomy framework by default.
Activate Bloom’s Taxonomy: Click "Use Bloom" button to enable the framework. Once activated, the button will turn blue and level chips will appear on each objective field.

data.text: For Existing Objectives

items.content: Click "Use Bloom" button.
The system will analyze the current objectives and align them with the appropriate levels of the taxonomy. You can manually adjust as needed to refine the alignment

data.text: For Generating New Objectives

items.content: Click "Use Bloom" button
Click the "Compose" button.
Objectives generated by AI will now include verbs and phrasing that correspond to the chosen levels of Bloom’s Taxonomy.

data.text:
💡 Tip
Using Bloom’s Taxonomy ensures that objectives are structured to meet specific learning levels, making them more precise and measurable.
Step 5: Specifying Course Outcomes
Outcomes describe measurable achievements learners should accomplish by the end of the course.
AI Assistance:

items.content: Click "Compose" to generate outcomes.

data.caption: Specifying Course Outcomes With AI Assistance

data.text: Create Manually:
Add outcomes manually in separate input fields.

items.content: Use the "Add Outcome" button to add more fields.

data.text:
🔎 Note
Clearly defined outcomes ensure alignment between your course goals and learner achievements.
Step 6: Navigating to the Next Step
Once you’ve completed all three blocks:

items.content: Click the "Units" button at the bottom of the page to go to the next step in creating a course.
Alternatively, use the "Units" tab in the header.

data.text: Step 7: Using the Rewrite Button
The Rewrite button is available for each block (Goals, Objectives, Outcomes) and allows you to regenerate content using AI while maintaining the structure of your course.
How to Use the Rewrite Button
1. Locate the "Rewrite" button next to the block you want to update.
2. Click the button to open a confirmation modal. The modal will display a warning that the existing content will be overwritten.
Choose one of the following actions:

items.content: Rewrite: Proceeds with overwriting the current content. AI generates new content based on the provided course details.
Cancel: Keeps the existing content and exits the modal.
X: Closes the modal window

data.text:
🔎 Note
The Rewrite feature is helpful for updating content when your course goals or needs change, such as refining course objectives to match updated course goals.
Step 8: Additional Features and Tips

items.content: Compose All: Generate all blocks simultaneously using AI for a quick start.
Rewrite Buttons: Available for each block to help refine content.
Confirmation Modals: Prevent accidental overwrites during Compose or Rewrite actions.

data.text:
💡Pro Tip
Regularly review generated content to ensure it aligns with your course's goals. Manual adjustments add a personal touch and make the course more unique.

By following these steps, you can efficiently structure learning objectives for your course, leveraging both manual entry and AI tools to suit your needs. Once complete, proceed to the Units page to continue course planning.

EN.cover-alt: From Goals to Results: Structuring Learning Objectives

EN.title: Structuring Learning Objectives
EN.description: On the Goals page, you can define the learning objectives for your course by creating Course Goals, Course Objectives, and Course Outcomes. This guide will walk you through how to manually create these blocks or use AI to generate them automatically, helping you build a comprehensive and organized course plan.

data.text: Step 1: Set Up Your Course
Start by filling out the basic information about your course.

items.content: Enter a clear and descriptive course name: For example, "Exploring 19th Century English Literature: From Romanticism to Victorianism".
Click the "Compose" button: EdSyl will generate an overall course goal that will serve as the basis for your learning objectives.

data.code:
<iframe 
title="Step 1: Set Up Your Course"
class="video-block" 
src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Mq7rCNBtHL8?modestbranding=1&controls=0&showinfo=0&rel=0&autoplay=1&mute=1&loop=1&playlist=Mq7rCNBtHL8" 
frameborder="0" 
allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" 
allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.text: Step 2: Generate Units and Lessons
After reviewing the generated learning objectives, it's time to create the structure of your course.

items.content: Navigate to the Units Tab: First, go to the "Units" tab and then click the "Compose" button to open a modal window where you can specify the details of your units.

Specify Units and Lessons: Enter the desired number of units for your course and then specify how many lessons you want for each unit. For example, if you choose six units, you might include four lessons in each unit, resulting in a total of twenty-four lessons.
Click "Compose": After entering the number of units and lessons, click "Compose". EdSyl will generate a structured outline based on your selections, providing a clear roadmap for your course content.

data.code:
<iframe 
title="Step 2: Generate Units and Lessons"
class="video-block" 
src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xBRn9Y-Me28?modestbranding=1&controls=0&showinfo=0&rel=0&autoplay=1&mute=1&loop=1&playlist=xBRn9Y-Me28" 
frameborder="0" 
allow="autoplay; encrypted-media"
allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.text: Step 3: Finalizing Your Course
After you have created your course title, objectives, units, and lessons, take a moment to review all of the generated content:

items.content: Review Generated Content: Take a moment to review all of the generated content.
Ensure Alignment: Make sure everything aligns with your teaching philosophy and meets the needs of your students.
Save and Export: Once you're satisfied, save and export your course in formats such as PDF or Word for easy sharing or classroom use.

data.code:
<iframe 
title="Step 3: Finalizing Your Course"
class="video-block" 
src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/YwIIlbyebwM?modestbranding=1&controls=0&showinfo=0&rel=0&autoplay=1&mute=1&loop=1&playlist=YwIIlbyebwM" 
frameborder="0" 
allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" 
allowfullscreen></iframe>

EN.description: Everything you need to know about your new favourite AI Teaching Companion - Do Hours of Work in MINUTES!

EN.title: Creating Course
EN.description: Creating a whole course has never been easier! With EdSyl's AI-powered platform, you can create an entire course in just three steps.

data.text: Step 1: Choose how to create a Unit

At the start of the Units page, you will see two main buttons for creating a unit: “Add Unit" and "Compose”. The “Add Unit” button allows to manually create a unit from scratch. In contrast, the "Compose" button uses artificial intelligence to quickly create a unit based on course goals and objectives.

data.caption: Choose how to create a Unit

data.text: Compose Course Plan
Click the "Compose" button to use AI to automatically generate units.
A settings window will appear where you can set:

items.content: Number of units (default is 5, but you can change the number).
Number of lessons in each unit (default is 5 lessons, but this value can also be changed).

data.text:
❗ Keep in mind
If you don't want to generate lessons at this stage, uncheck the corresponding checkbox. This is useful if you want to create the overall structure first and add lessons manually later.
If you don't want to generate lessons at this stage, uncheck the corresponding checkbox. This is useful if you want to create the overall structure first and add lessons manually later.
After configuring the settings, click the “Compose” button - units and lessons will be generated according to the settings, including their goals and objectives.
Add New Unit

items.content: Click the “Add Unit” button to add a new unit.
This will open a field to enter a name for the unit.
After entering the name, press Enter or click outside the box to save.

data.text:
❗ Keep in mind
A manually created unit at this stage only contains a name. To add Goals and Objectives, you will need to go to separate pages or use the AI generation feature (this process is described next).
Step 2: Work with created Units and Lessons
Once units are created or generated, they are displayed on the page as expanded cards, where you can see all the important information:

data.caption: Work with created Units and Lessons

data.text: Unit Card Contents

items.content: Unit Title: Displayed at the top of the card.
Goals and Objectives: Below the unit title, you can see the goals and objectives that were either added manually or generated by the AI.
Goals within a Unit: Within each unit, the lessons (if they have been created) are displayed, along with their titles, goals and objectives.

data.text: Editing Unit and Lesson titles

items.content: To change the name of a unit or lesson, click on the pencil icon next to the name.
Type the new name and press Enter or click outside the box to save.

data.code:
<iframe 
title="Editing Unit and Lesson titles"
class="video-block" 
src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Okn9lywNPyA?modestbranding=1&controls=0&showinfo=0&rel=0&autoplay=1&mute=1&loop=1&playlist=Okn9lywNPyA" 
frameborder="0" 
allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" 
allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.text: Editing Goals and Objectives

items.content: The goals and objectives field includes a redirect button that will take you to separate pages for editing goals and objectives. (The button is displayed when you hover your mouse over the field).

Direct editing of goals and objectives is not available on the Units page. However, AI-assisted content generation or regeneration buttons are available for each unit and lesson, allowing you to quickly create or update their content without leaving the current interface.

data.text: Deleting a Unit or Lesson
If you want to delete a unit or lesson, use the menu accessible via the three dots in the upper right corner of the card. Select the “Delete” option to remove the item from the course structure.

data.code:
<iframe 
title="Deleting a Unit or Lesson"
class="video-block" 
src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/PndU9cY6W1s?modestbranding=1&controls=0&showinfo=0&rel=0&autoplay=1&mute=1&loop=1&playlist=PndU9cY6W1s" 
frameborder="0" 
allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" 
allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.text:
🔎 Note
Use the AI button to generate if you need to change the content of a goal or objective. This will keep the structure but update the text.
Step 3: Add New Unit
At the bottom of the page, two options are available for adding new unit:
"Suggest" button

Allows you to automatically create a single unit with already defined goals and objectives, but no lessons. This creates a unit ready for further editing, which can be supplemented with lessons later.
"Add Unit" button:

This will open the unit's name field where you can enter the name of the unit. To fill in the goals and objectives fields, you must either go to the appropriate pages or use the generate function with AI.

💡 Useful tip
Using the "Suggest" button will help you quickly add new units to your course structure without having to manually enter goals and objectives and then detail them as needed.
Step 4: Manage Additional Unit Features
Additional buttons are available at the top of the page to help you manage units and update your course structure:
"Rewrite" button

items.content: Click to open the settings where you can enter the number of units and lessons.
You can then regenerate all course content based on the new settings, including goals and objectives.

data.text: "Add Unit" button
This button duplicates the functionality of the button at the bottom of the page and allows you to create a unit manually.

🔎 Note
The Rewrite feature is useful if you want to update the entire course, keeping the overall structure but refreshing the content.
Step 5: View Unit Cards: Open and Closed Views

For easy viewing and navigation of units and lessons, you can switch the display of cards between Open (shown as number 1 in the picture above) and Closed (shown as number 2 in the picture above) views by clicking the arrow to the left of the unit's or lesson's title:

data.caption: View Unit Cards: Open and Closed Views

items.content: Exposed cards: Shows all the details of the unit or lesson - goals, objectives and lessons. This is useful for detailed viewing and editing.
Collapsed cards: Shows only the name of the unit or lesson, hiding the detailed content. This helps reduce screen space and is useful for an overview of the course structure.

data.text:
💡 Tip
Use the closed view for quick navigation, and the open view when you want to see the unit and lesson content in more detail.
Step 6: Change the order of the Units
On the Units page, a reorder function is available that allows you to change the unit sequence so that you can organize the course structure easily.

items.content: Switch to closed view of cards: To use the reorder feature, units must be in closed view, displaying only their names. This helps keep things compact and makes it easier to navigate through the course.
Reorder units: Hold a unit card and drag it to a new position in the list. This way, you can easily change the sequence of units to better structure the content.

data.code:
<iframe 
title="Change the order of the Units"
class="video-block"
src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HXCCwBc3HxA?modestbranding=1&controls=0&showinfo=0&rel=0&autoplay=1&mute=1&loop=1&playlist=HXCCwBc3HxA"
frameborder="0" 
allow="autoplay; encrypted-media" 
allowfullscreen></iframe>

data.text:
💡 Useful tip
Using the drag-and-drop function is useful for quickly moving units around, especially if you want to adapt the order of the course depending on the complexity or logical sequence of topics.
Step 7: Preview and Print Units

At the top of the page, you will find a Print button that allows you to view and print the created course units. This will allow you to save the document as a PDF or export it as a Word file (.doc/.docX) for easy editing, printing, or sharing.

💡 Tip
Use the Preview feature to ensure the content looks consistent and clear before sharing it with others. This is particularly useful for teachers or collaborators who prefer a physical copy of the course outline.

These steps will help you efficiently create, customize, and manage your course structure on the Units page. Use AI capabilities to generate content quickly if you want to speed up the process or add units and lessons manually if you have a clear idea of the course structure. You can easily update and edit information to create an effective and easy-to-learn curriculum.

EN.title: Working with Units: A Step-by-Step Guide
EN.description: On the Units page, you can create and customize the structure of your course by adding units and lessons to make sure your course is logical and consistent. This step-by-step guide will help you understand the functions of the page so you can create and edit units, add goals and objectives, and manage course content.

EN.last-text: Easily add or expand units with AI-driven recommendations
EN.first-text: Generate a complete course structure in minutes
EN.second-text: Customize every step to align with your unique vision

data.text: AI-Powered Assistance at Your Fingertips
Create a fully structured course in just a few clicks and customize every detail to meet your teaching goals. Easily expand and refine your course with intuitive AI suggestions.

EN.title: Set Your Course Foundations
EN.description: Define the core of your course with clear learning objectives and measurable outcomes that set a strong direction for success.

name.EN: AI Chat: Your Intelligent Teaching Partner

EN.last-text: Improve the clarity and precision of your materials
EN.first-text: Rewrite and improve content with ease
EN.second-text: Brainstorm fresh ideas for creative lesson planning

data.code:
<iframe 
title="Editing Unit and Lesson titles"
width="100%"

data.text: AI Chat: Your Intelligent Teaching Partner
AI chat helps you effortlessly expand, rewrite, and optimize your lesson plans. Brainstorm ideas, refine materials, and create powerful content with intelligent suggestions.

EN.title: AI Chat: Your Intelligent Teaching Partner
EN.description: AI chat helps you effortlessly expand, rewrite, and optimize your lesson plans. Brainstorm ideas, refine materials, and create powerful content with intelligent suggestions.

EN.title: Everything you need to get started
EN.description: Create courses effortlessly and quickly with our user-friendly platform!

EN.title: Make Teaching Easy
EN.description:
Discover a smarter way to create, edit, and organize instructional materials.
Turn ideas into high-quality courses, units, lessons, and quizzes in no time.
Leave the paperwork to AI and dedicate more time to your passion for teaching!

EN.title: Transform your way of teaching with EdSyl
EN.description: Save time and get more done with EdSyl's powerful features. Effortlessly design courses, use AI support and manage your content with ease - all in one intuitive platform!
